alert.note: Alert for McDowell; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of McDowell, south central Raleigh and southern Wyoming Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Welch, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Welch, Pineville, Mullens, Gary, War, Northfork, Twin Falls State Park, Davy, Bradshaw, Keystone, Anawalt, Kimball, Rhodell, Jolo, Maybeury, Elbert, Coalwood, Avondale, Wolf Pen and Maben. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.

area.areaDesc: McDowell; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming
